articles.title: New dinosaur species emerges from pre-WWII fossil photos - The Washington Post
articles.description: The dinosaur was about as big as a Tyrannosaurus rex and had a unique nasal horn and symmetrical teeth that it used to eat its prey.
articles.content:
Scientists have identified a previously unknown dinosaur species from an unlikely source: photographs of fossils destroyed during the Allied bombing of Munich in World War II.
